description.value: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 4d6 persistent acid damage, and 4 acid splash damage. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls.

Activate A Strike

Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals 4d6 electricity damage and 4 electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Off-Guard] until the start of your next turn. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls.

Activate 1 Strike

The liquid reagents in this vial rapidly absorb heat when exposed to air. A frost vial deals the listed cold damage and cold splash damage. On a hit, the target takes a status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn. Many types of frost vial also grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls, the bomb deals 4d6 cold damage and 4 cold splash damage, and the target takes a -15-foot penalty.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.Effect: Frost Vial (Major)]

Activate 1 Strike

A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances. When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a -20-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls, and the Escape DC is 37.

On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Immobilized] for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don't have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.

Activate 1 Strike

When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36|name:Major Thunderstone|showDC:all] saving throw with the listed DC or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Deafened] until the end of its next turn. Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 4d4 sonic damage and 4 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 36.

A mix of digestive juices and green dragon poison glands nauseates the victim as its flesh is digested from within.

Activate A Interact (Contact)

Saving Throw DC 37 Fortitude

Onset 1 minute

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Sickened]{Sickened 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[7d6[poison]] damage and sickened 3 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[9d6[poison]] damage and sickened 4 (1 round)

Black lotus extract causes severe internal bleeding.

Activate A Interact (Contact)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42]

Onset 1 minute

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[15d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Drained]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[17d6[poison]] damage and drained 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[20d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Drained]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Activate A

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creature's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain [[/r (10d6+27)[healing]]]{10d6+27 Hit Points} and gain +4 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.Effect: Elixir of Life (True)]

Mindfog mist can be used to undermine spellcasters, as its effect on a victim's mental faculties are swift and powerful.

Activate A Interact (Inhaled)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:35]

Onset 1 round

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Confused] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 3} (1 round)

Stage 3 confused and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 4} (1 round)

Created from a daemon's powdered soul gems or refined from the waters of Abaddon's rivers, oblivion essence causes victims to rapidly age and decay.

Activate A Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Slowed]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 2}, and slowed 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[12d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 3}, slowed 1 (1 round)

Tears of death are among the most powerful of alchemical poisons, distilled from extracts of five other deadly poisons in just the right ratios.

Activate A Interact (Contact)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:46]

Onset 1 minute

Maximum Duration 10 minutes

Stage 1 @Damage[18d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Paralyzed] (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[25d6[poison]] damage and paralyzed (1 minute)

Stage 3 @Damage[30d6[poison]] damage and paralyzed (1 minute)
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.LowLightVision]

Blue Viper carries the following infused items:

3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Acid Flask (Major)]

5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Black Lotus Extract]

3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Bottled Lightning (Major)]

4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Elixir of Life (True)]

3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Frost Vial (Major)]

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Mindfog Mist]

3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Oblivion Essence]

3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Glue Bomb (Major)]{Tanglefoot Bag (Major)}

5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Tears of Death]

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Thunderstone (Major)]

These items last for 24 hours, or until the next time Blue Viper makes his daily preparations.

items.name: +3 status to all saves vs. transmutation

description.value:
Trigger A creature adjacent to Blue Viper hits him with a melee unarmed Strike.

Effect The triggering creature is exposed to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Dragon Bile]. This consumes the poison, and Blue Viper can't use Poisoned Coat again until he spends 10 minutes applying one dose of contact or injury poison to his clothing.

When Blue Viper successfully Strikes an off-guard creature with a poisoned weapon or exposes an off-guard creature to an inhaled poison, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to its initial save against that poison.

Frequency once per round

Effect Blue Viper accelerates the flow of time so his poisons run their course faster. He Interacts to draw a contact poison and throws it in the air, where it showers down in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 60 feet. All creatures in the burst are automatically exposed to the poison, bypassing any onset time, and each creature must attempt a saving throw against that poison. If a creature fails, the duration of any beneficial spells or effects affecting the creature are reduced by 3 rounds (or by 6 rounds on a critical failure).

Requirements Blue Viper is holding a contact or injury poison.

Effect Blue Viper swigs the poison and sprays it out of his mouth, affecting a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]. Blue Viper isn't exposed to the poison. All creatures in the cone are immediately exposed to the poison and each creature must attempt a Fortitude save against the poison.
Blue Viper's infused poisons have a DC of 47.
Blue Viper Interacts to draw an injury poison and applies it to a weapon he is holding.
Blue Viper Interacts to draw a bomb, then Strikes with it.

Blue Viper Interacts to draw an inhaled poison, deploys the poison in a smoke cloud that provides concealment in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], then Sneaks up to his Speed. He is not exposed to the inhaled poison.

allSaves.value: +3 status to all saves vs. transmutation
